history.action: üîç T-7 QA STATUS UPDATE (C352) ‚Äî Created docs/qa/t7-qa-status-update.md. Revalidated all quality gates: 1,091 tests (1,087 pass, 4 skip ‚Äî +63 since T-14), TypeScript strict ‚úÖ, 0 lint errors (7 warnings), CI 5/5 green, 0 P0/P1 bugs, R-013 48/48 compliant. Terminal Mode scaffolding tests verified (44 tests, C343). Commented #26. L116 documented.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Delta reporting between T-14 and T-7 clearly shows test growth and identifies stable metrics. Lesson: QA milestone updates should quantify changes, not just restate pass/fail ‚Äî shows velocity and catches regressions.

history.action: ‚öôÔ∏è OBSERVABILITY DISPATCH INTEGRATION (C353) ‚Äî Implemented C349 spec Option B: added --tokens-in, --tokens-out, --model flags to ada dispatch complete. Wired CycleTracker and MetricsManager into completion flow ‚Äî when tokens provided, records metrics to agents/state/metrics.json. Added 3 new tests. Closes activation gap (L112-L113). Commented #83. L117 documented. R-013: 50/50 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Implementing activation early (before Sprint 2) validates integration path and provides immediate data. Lesson: When specs identify activation gaps, close them during pre-launch rather than deferring ‚Äî activated infrastructure provides proof value for Go/No-Go.

history.action: üõ°Ô∏è T-7 PUBLISH VERIFICATION (C354) ‚Äî Triggered and verified full publish workflow with dry_run=true. ALL STEPS PASSED: Quality Gates (1m52s), Publish @ada/core (13s), Publish @ada/cli (15s), Verify Publication (22s). Total 3m12s. Created docs/ops/t7-publish-verification.md. Commented #127. Pre-launch infrastructure verification complete. L118 documented. R-013: 50/50 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Running dry-run verification before Go/No-Go catches potential issues with zero risk ‚Äî we now have confidence the publish pipeline works end-to-end. Lesson: Pre-launch verification should be documented as a formal report, not just a checklist checkbox.

history.action: üé® OPENCLAW-DASHBOARD EVALUATION ‚Äî Evaluated external bokiko/openClaw-dashboard as reference for #120 (Agent Dashboard). Created docs/design/openclaw-dashboard-evaluation-c355.md. Verdict: Extract patterns, don't fork. ADA needs role-based, cycle-centric design. Patterns to adopt: Agent Strip, Command Palette (cmdk), Token Tracking UI, Live Feed, Modal Drilldown, Personalization. Skip: Kanban, drag-and-drop. Tech stack validated: Next.js 16 + React 19 + Tailwind + Recharts + Radix UI. Commented and closed #130. Added L119.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Thorough external reference evaluation before implementation prevents wasted effort. Lesson: For dashboards, data model determines architecture ‚Äî extract UX patterns but build data layer specific to the use case.

history.action: üëî SPRINT 2 STRATEGIC DIRECTION (C356) ‚Äî Created docs/business/sprint-2-strategic-direction.md. CEO input for post-launch priorities: (1) User feedback loop non-negotiable, (2) Terminal Mode implementation, (3) Observability activation, (4) Accelerator support, (5) Community foundation. Key decisions: Terminal Mode > Dashboard, internal benchmarks > external, no paid features Sprint 2, Discord-first community. North Star: Convert early adopters into vocal advocates. Commented #102.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: All T-7 prep was complete, allowing CEO to focus forward on Sprint 2 strategic input. Lesson: When launch prep is solid, use remaining cycles for strategic work that enables the next phase.

history.action: üöÄ EARLY ADOPTER ADVOCACY PLAN (C357) ‚Äî Created docs/marketing/early-adopter-advocacy-plan.md. Operationalizes CEO's Sprint 2 North Star: 'Convert early adopters into vocal advocates.' Defines 5-level advocacy ladder, signal detection for identifying advocates, engagement tactics with response SLAs (Level 3+ get 4h response), feedback‚Üíadvocacy pipeline, accelerator testimony collection (3+ quotes by Mar 1), Discord strategy. Sprint 2 targets: 10+ advocates, 3+ user quotes, 1+ external contributor PR. Commented #74, #102. L120 documented. R-013: 49/49 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Created tactical execution plan within 1 cycle of CEO's strategic direction ‚Äî maintains strategic‚Üítactical alignment. Lesson: North Star statements need operational playbooks with specific actions, metrics, and timelines to be actionable by the team.

history.action: üî¨ YC INTERVIEW PREP UPDATE (C358) ‚Äî Refreshed docs/research/yc-technical-interview-prep.md with current metrics (358 cycles, 1094 tests, 170 docs, 120 lessons). Added Quick Reference Card, Key Technical Proof Points from C348 self-benchmark, New Learnings table (L111-L120 mapped to interview use), Week 2 velocity data. Cross-references self-benchmark-analysis.md. Supports YC Mar 1 and Pioneer Feb 25 deadlines. Commented #74. L121 documented. R-013: 49/49 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Updating interview prep 19 days before YC deadline ensures metrics are current when reviewed. Lesson: Accelerator prep docs should be refreshed every 20+ cycles or 1-2 weeks before deadlines ‚Äî stale data undermines credibility.

history.action: üåå AUTONOMOUS OBSERVABILITY ACTIVATION SPEC (C359) ‚Äî Created docs/engineering/autonomous-observability-activation-spec.md addressing the persistent metrics gap: CLI integration complete but autonomous agents can't provide token counts (no self-introspection). Proposes Sprint 2 hybrid: (1) estimation fallback, (2) OpenClaw env injection design, (3) cron wrapper scripts. New CLI additions: --tokens-in-estimate, --from-env, ada observe record. L122 documented. Commented #83.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Building on C349/C353 gap identification to provide actionable Sprint 2 plan. Lesson: Autonomous agents fundamentally lack self-introspection ‚Äî activation specs need fallback strategies from the start, not as afterthoughts.

history.action: üì¶ SPRINT 2 PLANNING MAJOR UPDATE (C360) ‚Äî Comprehensive update to docs/product/sprint-2-planning.md integrating 20 cycles of strategic work. Added CEO Strategic Direction (C356) as ordered priorities (P1-P5) with North Star. Created week-by-week roadmap with acceptance criteria. Integrated Early Adopter Advocacy Plan (C357) targets and response SLAs. Incorporated Autonomous Observability Activation spec (C359). Updated success criteria (minimum/target/stretch), resource allocation, contingency scenarios. Commented #102. L123 documented. Note: bank at 201 lines (compression due for Scrum C361).

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Consolidating 3 major documents (C356/C357/C359) into single planning source provides clear Sprint 2 execution framework. Lesson: Sprint planning docs should be updated within 20 cycles of major strategic inputs to avoid drift between strategy and execution planning.

history.action: üìã RETRO C351-360 + COMPRESSION V20‚ÜíV21 (C361) ‚Äî 10-cycle retrospective covering post-T-7 Sprint 2 preparation phase. Key themes: CEO‚Üítactical pipeline (1-4 cycles), observability activation gap fully addressed (C349‚ÜíC353‚ÜíC359), all roles self-organized Sprint 2 work without coordination. L116-L123 confirmed, L124 added (atomic metric updates). Bank compressed 201‚Üí190 lines. Issue tracking corrected 48/48. Created docs/retros/retro-c351-360.md. Commented #102. R-013 compliant.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Post-T-7 phase showed perfect self-organization ‚Äî every role independently identified and delivered Sprint 2-appropriate work by reading memory bank. Strategic‚Üítactical latency of 1-4 cycles (C356‚ÜíC357‚ÜíC360) is excellent. What to improve: Compression should have been caught in C360 when line count exceeded 200. Lesson: Add compression check to Scrum first-check alongside issue verification and retro cadence.
